question.title: Why Is My Key Listener Not Working (Java)
question.body:
I have a KeyListener inside a file called Input, along with a MouseWheelListener. While the MouseWheelListener works as expected, the KeyListener does not respond properly. I've looked around for solutions, but as I am new to Java, I can't pinpoint the issue. There are 4 files here they are, frame and panel are in the window folder and input and camera are in the IDK folder:

Frame:

package window;

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;

import IDK.input;

public class frame {

    public static JPanel p = new panel ();

    public static void main (String [] args) {

        createWindow ();
        input.inputDetect ();
    }

    public static void createWindow () {

        JFrame f = new JFrame ("frame");
        f.add (p);
        f.setDefaultCloseOperation (JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        f.setMinimumSize (new Dimension (800, 500));
        f.setLocationRelativeTo (null);
        f.setVisible (true);
    }
}

Panel:

package window;

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;

import IDK.camera;

public class panel extends JPanel {

    public void paint (Graphics g) {

        super.paint (g);

        g.fillRect (camera.viewBox.x, camera.viewBox.y, camera.viewBox.width, camera.viewBox.height);
    }
}

Input:

package IDK;

import java.awt.event.*;

import window.frame;

public class input {

    public static int notches;
    public static int keyCode;

    public static void inputDetect () {

        frame.p.addMouseWheelListener (new MouseWheelListener () {

            public void mouseWheelMoved (MouseWheelEvent e) {

                notches = e.getWheelRotation();
                camera.viewBoxCal ();
            }
        });

        frame.p.addKeyListener (new KeyAdapter () {
    
            public void keyPressed (KeyEvent e) {
    
                System.out.println ("test");
            }
        });
    }
}

Camera:

package IDK;

import java.awt.*;

import window.frame;

public class camera {

    static float [] camInfo = new float [3];
    public static Rectangle viewBox = new Rectangle ();

    public static void viewBoxCal () {

        camInfo [0] = 0.f;
        camInfo [1] = 0.f;

        if (input.notches > 0) {

            if (camInfo [2] < 10) {

                camInfo [2] += 0.1;
            }
        } else if (camInfo [2] > 0.1) {

            camInfo [2] -= 0.1;
        }

        viewBox = new Rectangle ((int) camInfo [0], (int) camInfo [1], (int) (frame.p.getWidth () * camInfo [2] / 10), (int) (frame.p.getHeight () * camInfo [2] / 10));
        System.out.println (viewBox);
        return;
    }
}
